attributes.action: ensure that the increase in revenue from increased Air Passenger Duty (APD) is allocated to carbon offsetting projects in accordance with the Code of Best Practice which is due to be operational in the Autumn of 2007
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The current rates of APD are:

Economy class flights in Europe, internal UK flights - £10

Business and first class flights in Europe - £20 

Economy class long-haul flights - £40

Business and first class long-haul flights - £80 

These figures represent a 100% increase on the rates in force prior to the 1st February 2007.

Defra launched a consultation on a Code of Best Practice for the provision of carbon offsetting to UK customers on 18 January 2007. The aim is to have an operational Code of Best Practice in the Autumn of 2007. 

As the premise for the increase is to reduce aviation emissions and the amount of revenue is directly proportional to such emitions, it follows that the most ethical way of spending the increased revenue is on carbon offsetting projects.
